poem:
**Trump and the Tech**

On a stage where pixels turn 
and algorithms spin tales of their own,  
a pen slides across paper,  
aimed at taming silicon dreams.  
In the dance of zeros and ones,  
who decides the color of thought,  
the shade of progress,  
or the laughter of machines?  
Perhaps we've programmed more  
than we imagined.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
